title: Find Second Largest
description:
Given an array of integers, find the second largest distinct element in the array.

If no second largest element exists (for example, if all elements are the same or the array has fewer than 2 elements), return -1.

Implement an efficient solution.

visibleTestCases.explanation: The largest element is 20, the second largest distinct element is 10.
All elements are equal, so there is no second largest element.

hints: Brute force: sort and scan for distinct values (O(n log n)).
Better: one-pass keep track of first and second distinct values (O(n), O(1)).

title: Find the Index of the First Occurrence in a String
description: Given two strings haystack and needle, return the index of the first occurrence of needle in haystack, or -1 if needle is not part of haystack. If needle is an empty string, return 0 (consistent with C's strstr() and Java's indexOf()).

visibleTestCases.explanation: The substring "ll" first occurs starting at index 2.

hints: Consider KMP algorithm for optimal solution.

title: First Missing Positive
description: Given an unsorted integer array nums, return the smallest missing positive integer. Your solution must run in O(n) time and use constant extra space.

visibleTestCases.explanation: 1 is found, but 2 is missing. Rearrange in-place using cyclic sort.

hints: Use cyclic sort to place positive numbers in their correct positions.
Place number i at index i-1 if possible.

title: Remove Duplicates
description:
Given an array of integers, remove duplicate elements and return the array with only unique elements in sorted order.

Implement an efficient solution.

visibleTestCases.explanation: Duplicates (2 and 4) are removed, unique sorted array is [1,2,3,4].
All elements are duplicates, only one '5' remains.

hints: Use a Set data structure to store unique elements.

title: Reverse Array
description:
Reverse the given array in-place.

Implement an efficient solution.
hints: Use two pointers from start and end.
Swap elements at both pointers and move towards center.

title: Sum of Array
description:
Calculate the sum of all elements in the array.

Implement an efficient solution.
hints: Iterate through all elements and maintain a running sum.
Use built-in reduce/sum functions if available.
